Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location but simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two different times during our holiday in Mexico. First time - we stayed one week in a beach front room. Second time in a sea view room for one night. We recommened staying in a sea view because it´s a lots of sounds from nearby restaurants in the beach front room. The sea view rooms are much quieter than the beach front rooms . The rooms are very easy and a bit durty. But the garden are nice and the service is good. Location is superb. I recommend this hotel to you that want a simple hotel with good service and good location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value prime location”
Reviews.Author: Hans P
Reviews.Content: We looked at more than 30 hotels on the net and decided for this one. We wooried when we learned a week before check-inn that our rooms selection was no possible. But we were offered a nice alternative and have had a great 4 nights stay. Rooms 303-305 are quit with good seaview and 201 and 218 perfect seafront views with balcony. Noise from nearby disco is there every night but you get to live with it and it dissapears when the aircon is on.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen get away”
Reviews.Author: marco_carlson
Reviews.Content: It's small, quaint and quiet. It's easy, just a few blocks from the bus station and right off the down town 5th avenue area. If you're not looking for big fancy places and want convenience and ease. This is it. Inexpensive too. One draw back is the constant "bump, bump, bump", from the local club/s nightlife. That can drive you a little crazy.

Reviews.Title: “would probably stay again, but....”
Reviews.Author: Rob a
Reviews.Content: stayed in beach front room and had a mostly good stay. location in relation to restaurants, beach stuff is pretty much perfect, no problems there. didn't catch(don't remember) his name but the front desk staff was friendly and helpful, no problems there. property is a bit old and on the beach (in Mexico) so condition and facilities are about what you'd expect. Not bad, maybe a little damp,musty but, again it;s on the beach and it's no worse than pretty much any where else. I guess the room looked just a little tired but, again, our room was on the beach and the weather, sun, wind, sand, etc, is gonna give it a battering. king size Bed was OK, prob a bit hard. no big issue for me or my gf. but honestly, no exaggeration, the pillows were as thick and hard as a cinder block. when i first layeddown i actually wondered what they were. laughably bad. all in all no real, deal breaker type problems with the condition of the room itself For me, the real deal breaker was noise, as all night long music from several locations up and down the beach. also quite a bit from people on the beach as well. I'm sorry to say that for me it was unbearable. Funny thing, i was chatting with another guest in the morning that had stayed in one of the inner rooms in the hotel and she said her room was quiet as a tomb. if i return it will definatly be one of those and not the beach front room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel without luxury”
Reviews.Author: LMRGAdvisor
Reviews.Content: direct at nice beach, rooms are ok and clean, no high-end hotel but everything needed was available: safe, small fridge, A/C, TV (for those who need it), during the night you can hear a little bit the entertainment in the neighborhood, nice view to Isla Cozumel if you book OCEAN VIEW. 1 min-walk to pedestrian zone where you find many tourist shops and restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “I return every year!”
Reviews.Author: Annasanjose
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Pelicano Inn. It is very well-priced, right on the beach, in the middle of downtown Playa Del Carmen. The location is ideal! Steps to everything you could possibly want.....shopping, restaurants, bars, clubs, and the beach and beautiful ocean of course! I always get an oceanfront room that has a gorgeous view of the beach and lovely water. The rooms are simple, but have what you really need: beds, shower, closet, mirror, table, refrigerator, and a nice patio with a table, chairs, and a lounge. The staff is very friendly and will always help with any little problems, but the one person who always helps me and makes me smile is the wonderful concierge/reception person, Luis Rivera. He has always been so warm, understanding, and helpful. He is an excellent staff member!!!! I will always return here because I love the location and the friendliness of the staff who always call me by name. They are delightful people. I love this hotel and I love Playa Del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: runwench
Reviews.Content: The Pelicano Inn is in a great location and the rooms are well priced for being on the beach. They are not luxurious, but they have a bed, a bathroom with hot water and a small refridgerator. The staff, especially Luis, were always friendly and helpful. We had to change rooms a few times and he helped us with our luggage. Get one of the oceanview rooms and you are practically sleeping on the beach! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “You looking for A FIVE star Hotel??????”
Reviews.Author: lovePlayadelCarmen
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Pelicano Inn for over ten years. I think it is the best deal in town. Sure, it might need some attention paid to some areas, but I go for the sun, food and the beach. I can get along without some things in order to enjoy what the hotel offers. Here are my thoughts................ If you are looking for a TV in your room, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you are looking for a phone in your room, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you are looking for whirlpools in your room, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you think the room you stay in is more important than the time you spend out of the room, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you have to have free water bottles, every day, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you are looking for everything to be perfect, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you think you need to spend $200.00/$300.00 a night to be happy, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. If you are looking for a Five Star Hotel, Hotel Pelicano Inn is not the place for you. HOWEVER>>>>>>>>>>>>>> If you want to hear the waves while laying in bed, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you. If you want to sit on your balcony and people watch, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you. If you want to stay right on the beach, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you. If you can survive in a room that might not have a towel bar, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you. If you can survive in a room where the light fixture may not be tight against the ceiling, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you. If you can survive in a room that might not have a shower mat, Hotel Pelicano Inn is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl210
Reviews.Content: Quick Overview... All in all this was my Worst experience in Playa del Carmen. I'm not a picky person when it comes to hotels in Playa del Carmen. We look for location, clean, affordable, and relaxing. We do not stay all-inclusive and prefer the smaller boutique hotels. This hotel has a wonderful location but needs extensive updates and maintenance. I should have demanded a refund and went to another hotel. I would not stay here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone else. Many other places in Playa with comparable or better rates with much better facilities. Detailed Review... My husband and I stayed at Hotel Pelicano Inn for 5 nights. Jan 8-13, 2011. We have been to Playa several times and decided this trip to fly down and find a place to stay instead of doing reservations. (we did our online research, reviews, etc and had list of options to check). So I was told they had rooms available and we could stay in Oceanview room for 3 nights and then move to an Oceanfront room remaining 2 nights. I did take a look at the room before booking. Paid for all 5 nights and walked to our room. Then it all went downhill from there... Just as an FYI - there are no tv’s or radio/clocks in the rooms. Room 306 - clean, spacious room but dated with suprisingly comfortable bed for Mexico. My husband had to move the small refrigerator to different area of room to find an outlet that would work. Water would not work when I went to flush toilet, sink and shower no water. So go to front desk to be told it will be fixed right away. Three hours later they tell us it's fixed. So we have wasted half of our day waiting around. Noticed a slight smell but thought maybe it was where water had been off for some time. Went to dinner came back and smell was worse. Decided to close door to bathroom and see what the morning would hold. Well I almost got sick when I went to use bathroom next morning, it smelled like pure sewage. So we went downstairs to tell front desk something has to be done. This was on Sunday. I was told manager was not working and was out of town. I explained the smell was horrible and we should be moved that we were wasting our vacation. He explained we could pay extra and move to Oceanfront room. I would not agree to paying extra as the reason for moving was not out of my convenience. Housekeeping agreed there was definitely a problem in room. Finally around 12 noon after several trips of speaking with front desk I told them to either refund our money for the entire stay or move us to an Oceanfront room with no extra cost. Finally they told us we could move to oceanfront room. Room 218 - Oceanfront room... Again clean but needs updates. The lamp in the room looked to have either so much dust gathered on it or it was mildew. There was no ceiling fan in this room and the lighting was very minimal. Shower had lots of pressure but at best the water was luke warm never any Hot water. The bed in this room was more than undesirable, even for Mexico. The bed sank in the middle (I don’t mean you rolled to the middle it was broken length wise in the middle. It was shaped like a banana. After 4 nights of this bed my husband and I both were aching in our hip and back (and we are only 30&31 years old). This room also had small refrigerator. The view from this room was beautiful with large, spacious balcony. You could hear the music from Fusion at night. The music played some nights until 2am but with the balcony door closed you could hardly hear the music. The music was actually quite nice especially since we did not have tv or radio. Housekeeping staff did good job keeping the room clean. Most of the problems we encountered are more on the level of managment and owner issues that need to be addressed in order for this hotel to be a pleasant stay. The sad part is the location and lay out of hotel makes for potentially nice hotel someone just needs to come in and spruce the place up quite a bit. Again much better hotels for same or cheaper prices in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Supberb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Garypsw
Reviews.Content: Awsome hotel. The hotel has an excellent location and was extremely clean. However, it was the supberb staff that makes this hotel one of a kind! I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Pelicano!”
Reviews.Author: SallyM2010094
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation to Merida and Playa del Carmen and we stayed 3 nights at the Pelicano. Our beach front room was spacious, clean and comfortable (including the beds) - and only steps from the most beautiful beach I have ever seen! The Pelicano is not "fancy" but it is lovely. Muchas gracias to Luis who made us feel right at home. The restaurant offers delicious food - we had breakfast every morning on the beach! After breakfast, lounging on the beach -- lounge chairs and umbrellas provided. It was wonderful! The service was excellent, but I want to say a special "thank you" to Leo who works in the restaurant. A very comfortable, reasonably priced hotel in a perfect location (one block from 5th avenue). Check out the Pelicano - you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “I'm working there!!”
Reviews.Author: karina_audiffred
Reviews.Content: I've been reading all your comments, and i can understand the both sides, worst and the better, but let me say you that we're working a lot for get better our services and give you a beatiful and funcional hotel with a great location!! We have 39 rooms with air conditioned, a nice beach, amenities, bottles of water, some rooms with fridge, iron and hair dryer by request, tours, Restaurant, next opening: bar in the beach!! Please remember: we don't have TV or phone (only at front desk) for your tranquility and relaxing days.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenverDisappointed
Reviews.Content: Place is a dump. I wouldn't pay $25 in the states for a room like this. We booked a room with two beds. Showed up. Room had two headboards and only one bed. Talked to front desk and they said they cannot do anything. Light in the shower was a light bulb hanging from wires. Yes bare wires in the shower. I thought at first that I just got the worst room. I looked in the window of other rooms and they also had two head boards and one bed. Also very classic room furniture. 2 plastic chairs and a plastic table. Two towels in the room would be something I would have in my garage for washing the car. Stay clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: keywestjoan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pelicano...I was very worried due to the 50 - 50 reviews right before I left. Let me tell you they must have been some anal people w/ the 50 bad reviews. You do get dropped off by whatever your means of travel is one 1/2 blk from hotel. due to 5 th ave being NO vehicle street. BUT if you look to the right before you get to the beach you will see a small breezeway right into their hotel lobby. So you do NOT have to drag your suitcase through the sand. Everyone working there (sorry forget their names) Ramon the mgr i think he was super sweet and so was the female. Actually they even had blow dryers to use while there but not in the room. The room (who could ask for more) right on the beach clean. Yes there was some mold up in the corner of the shower but NO biggie. This is humid Mexico. The room was cleaned everyday. An extra towel would have been nice but we never even got a chance to ask for one ....which i am sure they would have given us. i would have no problem staying here again or telling my friends to go here. like all the reviews.......GREAT LOCATION. This is not a 5 star hotel and this is exactly the type of hotel I wanted. As for the restaurants (not the hotel restaurant) and stores...Be prepared as this area is not cheap. we never paid under 35.00 us dollars for dinner and breakfast we never paid under 18.00 for 2. Dresses I can get here in us for 15.00 are selling for 35.00 us. We never did get to eat at our hotel so we cannot say how the food was.

Reviews.Title: “Pelicano Inn - value for small money”
Reviews.Author: Pyntenissen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pelicano Inn for 14 days in february. Cheapest hotel in catalog, but the only available. Simple rooms, hard bed, but clean, towels and bed changed every day. Staff were nice. Situated right on the beach. Best vacation for the money ever. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessuli
Reviews.Content: Before I left I read the other reviews and prepaired for the worst. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The location of Pelicano Inn cannot be beat. It's absolutely perfect. The staff is great, very friendly with a lot of smiles. Luis at the reseption is awesome. He is so friendly and has a great sence of humor. Had many laughs with him. The rooms are basic, but they are spotless. I would recommend a room with a ocean view, that one had a fridge. The view is great also :) Had the best time ever in Pelicano Inn. It is not Hilton, but it was exactly what we wanted. Did a stop at Playacar and couldn't wait to get out of there! Pelicano Inn is a perfect choise for a small MEXICAN hotel to anybody. Recommend, recommend, recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: icepm
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pelicano Inn about Bestday.com at the Cancun airport. We paid nearly 80$ per night. Therefor we got free internet access and this is the only positive about the room we got. The room is the ugliest room i ever saw. There is mold everywhere and a really badly smell. The water pipes are in a really bad condition. And the sprinkler in the shower is full of rust and can hardly give some drops of water. The beds are old not very nice wood beds. The fan is really ugly and full of black dust. The A/C is not working, so it makes noices but do not cool the air in the room. The "safe" or more the metal box is without a key and full of rust stains. The towels and also the bedcovers are old and full of undefineable stains. We also looked at a second room and there also the light didn't worked and the rest was the same. So do not stay here!!!! There are better and cheaper hotel and motel and hostels around here.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AlanKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: We are two seniors who have spent holidays a number of times in Playa del Carmen since 1989, as well as in other parts of Mexico. We always stay at small Mexican hotels. We go on holiday to get away from our over-regulated home country. We like having to improvise. We like being in a place where not everyone speaks English. We like having to find our way in unfamiliar places and situations. The toilet and the shower in our room were clean and worked well. There was always hot water. Some of the tiles had dark lines around them, but this is a tropical place, and mould can appear overnight. The furnishings in our room were plain, but adequate. Our room was cleaned daily by the same cheerful lady who made the beds so that they looked crisp after her every visit. After she had cleaned our room, the toilet and washbasin area were sparkling clean, and whatever it was that she mopped the floor with, left the room with a pleasant smell. We did not care that she spoke only Spanish: We communicated by supplementing our meager Spanish with sign language. It was fun. Mario, at the front desk, always had a cheerful smile and an Ola! He’d seemed a bit glum on our first day, but my wife did an exaggerated mime of a smile at him, which broke the ice and we got on well. When I told him that some of the lights in our room were burned out, he had them replaced right away. Typically for a small Mexican hotel, some switches were broken. There were more than enough electrical outlets for our needs. Staff at the beach tended to look a bit sour, although they always got an umbrella for us when we asked. My wife found the mattress to be too hard. It has always been so, wherever we’ve been in Mexico, so she always brings a self inflating camping mattress that gives her the comfort she needs. We especially liked having our own security box, where we could lock up our passports and other valuables whenever we needed to. There was one negative thing about our visit, an issue referred to by a previous reviewer: the room that we had reserved (and prepaid for) was not available when we arrived late at night. We were going to make an issue of it, but found no fault with the room they gave us, and decided to let the matter rest. The problem might have arisen because, although most people have weekend arrivals/departures, we were mid-weekers. Midweek airfares were lowest for us. We’d have liked to have had a small refrigerator, and the price we paid ($100/night) would seem to have justified that; however, we had booked rather late, so there wasn’t much choice in hotels, and anyway, there was a Mini Mart about 50 feet from the Pelicano entry. Did we enjoy our stay at the Pelicano? Yes! – Alan Cobden

Reviews.Title: “A sad fate for a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: RangerDon
Reviews.Content: I must unfortunately concur with the other reviews. Even though I used this site to review the hotel prior to going, we tried to keep a good attitude and hoped for the best when booking here. We have been at the Pelicano three , now four times since 1995. The first time included a free buffet breakfast, new towels each day formed into those wonderful swans and other animals and a staff that were wonderful and made our stays great. Those days are over -period. The present management only wants your money without giving any service back. The beach bar staff, when even present, are surly and not pleasant. The rooms are filthy, with loud air conditioners, leaking toilets, electric wires hanging out of the wall etc. The beds were atrocious and had some kind of pad, not a mattress. Perfectly acceptable in a 1/2 star hotel- not a three star as advertised. There is NO area with shade for the hotel guests on the beach. All the palapas once set aside for guests are now used by the bar. They stood empty the entire four days of our stay. You had to buy a drink to sit under one. Our son had a drink from the adjoining restaurant ( We couldn't find any staff to get one from the Pelicano) and instantly staff appeared from seemly nowhere and told him he couldn't have any drinks other than ones bought there. A reasonable request but downright stupid when we were the only ones there and we were paying guests. My advice in order to remain in this most wonderful of locations- right on the beach, close to Fifth Ave. and the ferry terminal- is to try the Treetops which is currently being remodeled (Sept '07) The old Albatross Hotel is gone, replaced by a new hotel. It may be OK -wasn't open yet. Most of the small hotels are being replaced by condos. Playa is rapidly turning into a mini-Cancun. More time-share hawkers than ever. Watch out for them. Fifth Avenue is now paved and runs seemly for miles from the ferry landing all the way down to the new resort hotels on the north beach. The new cruise ship pier is creating severe beach erosion. I saw sandbags all along the area around the pier to hold on to the beach. The local shops are being pushed out, replaced by high end boutiques, mostly Italian. In fact the town seems to be heavily catering to Italians with restaurants and shops. Playa has always been very international ( part of it's charm) but It just seemed that more emphasis was being put on Italians this time. So - Maybe Akumal is the new place to go?

Reviews.Title: “Agree with comments about staff”
Reviews.Author: Icemangk
Reviews.Content: Staff definitely apathetic. They have forgotten that they are in the service industry and at the very least could be courteous. Most services are extra so you would expect them to give you their best to make more money (revenue and tips) but they just don't seem to care. Beach towels were not available during our three day stay (at $1/day ea. they should be available). Restaurant not open most of the time (breakfast opened after 9:00, too late for most of us). It as though the owner is indifferent to whether or not the hotel is successful or not. Maybe he/she is waiting to sell. Still you would think that selling a good business is better than selling a lousy one.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever...”
Reviews.Author: mermelada777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pelicano Inn for the new year because all the nice hotels around town had minimum stay policy. This was the only hotel available for us near the beach, so we picked it up without much expectation. However, Pelicano Inn was the worst hotel we ever stayed in all over the world. I cannot complain about aged building and stinky room with this price range (it was about $110/night, not too much for the holiday season), but I was hoping it would be at least clean. The room was so dirty, with a lot of dust and a bunch of hairs on the floor. The sheets were not just dirty but also worn out badly. Mexican people working for such small hotels in this town are always nice, but not at Pelicano Inn. They are rude and not courteous at all. One staff did not even say hi or welcome when we checked in. All he cared was us paying a balace, and there was no explanation for the safety box or breakfast. I was thinking why they are in tourism business if they don't even want to talk to their guests nicely. On the first night, we couldn't find towels in our room and went to the front desk asking for them nicely. The staff who was there when we checked in said they would be up in our room when we returned from dinner, but they were not. I went back to the front desk again, and he gave me beach towels. I was asking for bath towels but he said "it is the same!" without any apology. At this point, I already wanted to leave Pelicano Inn and actually looked for a room at next door (nicest Alhambra, and pretty new mosquito hotel) but of course there was no vacancy. Next morning around 8 am, my husband went down to the front desk asking if there was a hair dryer he could borrow, but there was only a sleeping security person. When my husband talked to him, he opened his eyes and went back to sleep. My husband was trying to wake him up, but he never opened his eyes again even though he was hearing what my husband saying. My husband was upset and looked for someone else, but there was no one around. At 8 in the morning, no staff but sleeping security in the hotel. I have never faced this situation in the all the other small hotels in town, even in the much cheaper motels. Another guest who saw my husband talking to him was saying "I asked for a wake-up call but he didn't wake me up, this hotel sucks!" No wonder the hotel still had vacancy in the new year even though it is located on the perfect area on the beach. On the second and third night, we got really dirty, worn out towels with blood stain and other kinds of stains. On the fourth night, we did not get towels again. We tipped enough for the maid, and I have no idea why they were like this. The room was never cleaned properly during our stay. On the check out day, the same staff did not even say good bye or thank you. I asked him if the cab fare to the airport was still $39, but he said he did not know and it would depend on the driver. The cab fare is fixed in most of the case, especially to the airport, and I thought it was my fault that I still tried to communicate with him. We did not see any smile or did not hear any greeting from any staff and they seem really sick of working there. It is more than "unfriendly", it is just "rude". Here is a suggestion. There are many nice hotels around, so please do not let this hotel ruin your vacation. I wish I could give 0 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Becky55
Reviews.Content: very basic and very cheap. They did not give us hand towels or wash cloths even after i asked. The bed was hard. There was no TV, no clock and I couldnt get a second room key.. It is on the beach and the location is about perfect. If you don't need fancy then stay here. I am not in the room long enough for it to matter. Shower was large and had lots of hot water. They had night guards but they were usually asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly (& criminal) !!!”
Reviews.Author: Martino_Germany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pelicano Inn in July 2006. Staff at the front desk has been VERY unfriendly (and criminal??). We had to sign a blanco visa strip as a deposite while checking in. Questions for an alternative deposite (passport) where turned down within giving reasons. While checking out, the front desk staff claimed that we never signed anything and showed as a bunch of credit card strips as a proove. I called the police and suddenly, our credit card strip DID show up. And guess what .... no explanations and no appology. Just a few very unpolite side comments. Luckily, we had enough time to handle this with the police. CONCLUSION: Please try to avoid this trouble maker hotel! There are so many hotels in Playa with a much better price/performance ratio!! Have a nice vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for our next trip . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Pelicano Inn and we can't wait for our 4th. Ocean front view, Massage on the beach, low key no pressure atmosphere and dining within walking distance. If you are looking for pampering at the price of a pretty penny this is not the place for you. The room fits your every need from A/C to cleanliness. There is a safe in every room at no cost - Just ask for the key. A must stay for world travelers. You can't beat the price. Everything is Negotiable in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “be carefull might ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: hagargal
Reviews.Content: OK so we made reservations for two rooms 3 nights. first we paid for the ocean view room and we got the garden view room. then we have hot water in the shower, the air condition partialy works, and the room was stink. we asked for hot water and we also asked to move to our ocean view room. finally we moved. Then, on our 2nd day, we asked to stay one more night. the guy in the reception told us that there is no problem. on our last day we went to tulum but because one of our friends got sick she stayed in the room. suddenly the guy from the reception knocked on her door and told her that she must take all the stuff out or else he calls the police. she told him that we reserved the rooms for one more night. he said that he doesnt care since we didnt pay for it (no one told us that we must pay upfront and we thought we can pay on our check out) anyway, he told her to pack both rooms things or else he does it himself. then he went and sut off the electricity in the room and went to our room and started to touch our stuff. eventually, we got another night (becasue she was very sick, alnoe and crying) and he told her that by chance some room was canceled and we can move to this one. they got a room with out electricity and water in bathroom. also they were very rude and cursed us!!!

Reviews.Title: “likewise”
Reviews.Author: Drew S
Reviews.Content: I'm in agreement with most of the reviews about this hotel. While not expecting luxury (this was my second time at this hotel), and really who can beat eighty bucks for a beachfront room, there were some problems that could prevent me from staying at this awesome little hotel again until the owner decides to start paying attention. There's too much competition these days: No receipt for the room, and I paid in cash. Was told that there were no receipts left after a group of 25 checked in. Cost of the room went to 120 if I paid by CC. At least one surly waiter. The first morning, I walked into the restaurant to get a cup of coffee form the percolator, but was told that the coffee was "for the group of 25." What?? Am I not a guest at the hotel? Did I do the wrong by getting my own cup? If so, why wasn't I offered a cup later...they knew I wanted some coffee! This waiter had some serious customer service issues. Of course I had some issues of my own, as this was my second week of quitting smoking. I was nasty to this same waiter when he asked me to move my reclining chair from underneath a palapa. Those are reserved for tables, which are put out around lunchtime. But they guy again didn't ask very nice. I did eventually move and received an umbrella for shade. The waitstaff is very lethargic. Some of the beach waiters in Playa, especially those in front of Capt Dave's and the Mimi work hard and always receive a good tip from me. Considering that the waitstaff at the pelicano have their beach plus the beach right next door where you rent beach chairs you would think that they could make a decent living if they hustled. Not much tip from me; I had to get up whenever I wanted something. The air conditioner in the upstairs beachfront room did not work well, and yes it leaked on my clothes. One morning a squatter had taken over the massage tent, until about 11am. The guy may have been homeless, or he may have been too borracho to continue walking, but in any case the hotel staff should have made him gone at 8am, or whenever they arrived. A couple of the waitstaff's friends partied for two days at the beach bar. Should this be a problem? Maybe not, but they were very drunk; one of them almost drowned in the ocean. A complaint to the front desk resulted in...more beer served to the guy. There was trash right at the entrance to the beach - a twelve-pack carboard container and a couple of coffee cups in plain view that were never picked up during my stay. Contrast this to the guy next door that rents the beach chairs, who spent almost an hour every day raking his entire area. It looked nice. Either his boss forced him to clean his area, or maybe he just took pride in his work, something that the beach staff at the pelicano don't do. Spotty service from the maids. Sometimes I didn't get water, sometimes I only got one towell. Still this is a pretty good little hotel for the price I paid. I think that everyone could agree that the owner really doesn't have to do anything to his property, other than make sure that his taxes are paid, and he'll still make his money when he sells. Too bad, the Pelicano could be first-rate, but it would take a blow-out of the current staff.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, wont go back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Pelicano in 4 years and have noticed a steady decline in all aspects of the hotel. We tend to like smaller hotels and don't expect much attention but the Pelicano has really crossed the line. We found the beachfront room to be needing a complete remodel. A list of problems: AC not working, dirty walls, trash in the landscaping, beach loungers few and in poor repair, not enough beach umbrellas, rude staff, people lurking around the patio all night, (frightening - this was the last straw and we checked out early), hammock stolen, no hot or warm water, in fact the shower only emitted a fine mist (at this point on the first day I had to laugh it was so bad), old threadbare towels, no beach towels. We could feel a real atmosphere of apathy among all the staff. It is too bad since the location is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Ever Go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 3rd trip to Playa and our first stay at the Pelicano. We will go back to Playa next year - but will not return to the Pelicano. The people that work at that place are the rudest and least friendly of any that we have met in Mexico. Many of the beach lounge chairs were broken and couldn't be used. It is the only facility that we have found that does not have beach towels available for guests. We were told by two different individuals that breakfast at the restaurant was included with our room (it wasn't). We received two threadbare bath towels each day - no wash clothes or hand towels. I asked - but was told that we could only have the two bath towels. There was only a thin sheet on the mattress and no mattress pad - ugh. There was never any hot (or even warm) water. The website said that hammocks were provided - they were not. It was interesting to see that only a very few guests used the restaurant or the bar at the Pelicano - the staff at both were us grumpy as those working at the front counter. Guests used the services at neighboring beach front hotels and were treated great. We didn't go the Pelicano expecting luxury - we enjoy adventure. The location of the Pelicano is super - if the hotel was managed better - it could be a great place.
